children.text: The cladding in this area has not been constructed with care or skill, which generally looks poorly finished.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 5.02 Wall Cladding, states that

‘Staining, folds, splits, dents, open joints between panels, cracking and other distortions in wall cladding are defective if they are visible from a normal viewing position at ground level or an upper floor level’ .
The builder warrants that the work will be carried out in
, which is not the case in this area, and will require the cladding be properly rectified in accordance with the above requirements.
